answers.answer: I think it's pretty safe- just mention it to your doctor, but it doesn't cause any issues that I know of.  Congratulations!

Neskee,  you REALLY need to be in contact with your doctor.  You've had IVF treatment,  and thankfully (woohoo!) have conceived naturally.  I'm wondering why, with all this medical intervention, you're asking this question on the internet?
My doctor told me to take fish oil.
I was told to take fish or flex seed oil to help combat the risks of preeclampsia. I'm petty due its safe but I would still contact your doctor.
I take over-the-counter pregnancy vitamins and there are 2 pills to take daily, one is a general vitamin and the other is an omega 3 fish oil pill. I would think the doctor would encourage fish oils.
Thank you all for your inputs! Congratulations as well and enjoy the joirney of pregnancy :)
It is safe, I'm 40yo, 32weeks. Great for baby's heart, your moods, help relieve constipation.

question: Hi. Im a first time Mom, turning 35 yrs old next week. I am taking fish oil and folic few months before I get pregnant in preparation for mg 3rd  IVF cycle. Thank God I conceived naturally. :) Is it safe to continue my fish oils? Im already on my 16weeks :) Thanks a lot!
title: Fish Oil supplements
